content: कार्य {%<ab>pot. p.</ab>%} [कृ-कर्मणि ण्यत्] What ought to be done, made, performed, effected &c.; कार्या सैकतलीनहंसमिथुना स्रोतोवहा मालिनी <ls>Ś. 6. 16</ls>; साक्षिणः कार्याः <ls>Ms. 8. 61</ls>; so दंडः, विचारः &c. --र्यं {@--1@} ({%a%}) Work, action, act, affair, business; कार्यं त्वया नः प्रतिपन्नकल्पं <ls>Ku. 3. 14</ls>; <ls>Ms. 5. 150.</ls> ({%b%}) A matter, thing. {@--2@} Duty; <ls>Śi. 2. 1.</ls> {@--3@} Occupation, enterprize, emergent business. {@--4@} A religious rite or performance. {@--5@} A motive, object, purpose; कार्यमत्र भविष्यति <ls>Pt. 2. 65</ls>, <ls n="Pt. 2.">113</ls>; <ls>Śi. 2. 36</ls>; <ls>H. 4. 61.</ls> {@--6@} Want, need, occasion, business (with <ab>instr.</ab>); किं कार्यं भवतो हृतेन दयितास्नेहस्वहस्तेन मे <ls>V. 2. 20</ls>; तृणेन कार्यं भवतीश्वराणां <ls>Pt. 1. 71</ls>, <ls n="Pt.">4. 27</ls>; <ls>Amaru. 71.</ls> {@--7@} Conduct, deportment. {@--8@} A law-suit, legal business, dispute &c; बहिर्निष्क्रम्य ज्ञायतां कः कः कार्यार्थीति <ls>Mk. 9</ls>; <ls>Ms. 8. 43.</ls> {@--9@} An effect, the necessary result of a cause (<ab>opp.</ab> कारण). {@--10@} (In <ab>gram.</ab>) Operation; विभक्ति कार्यं declension. {@--11@} The denouement of a drama; कार्योपक्षेपमादौ तनुमपि रचयन् <ls>Mu. 4. 3.</ls> {@--12@} Healthiness (in medicine). {@--13@} Origin. [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Germ.</ab> {%kāra%}; Pers. {%kār%}; Prāk. {%kajja%}; <ab>Mar.</ab> {%kāja%}].
